page.title: 11BEDDINGTON PARK
page.content: The most important feature close to our school is Beddington Park, a large open park with recreational fac- ilities and places of interest. In the Park is Carew Manor dating back to 1350, named after the Carew family. A fire in 1865 destroyed most of the house but the Great Hall with many carvings still remains. It is said that the bell tower is haunted. The building is now a special school. St.Mary's Church is next to Carew Manor. Sir Walter Raleigh is rumoured to be buried there and not at St.Marg- aret's in Westminster. His wife is said to haunt the graveyard. We are very fortunate to have the River Wandle flowing through the Park. It is not very wide nor is it deep and the only fish it appears to contain are sticklebacks and minnows. There is now a scheme to clean up the river and
